meanings.sent1: After the ice melted, it began to regelate into a solid form.
meanings.sent2: If you leave the ice cream out too long, it will regelate and become hard again.
meanings.sent3: The frozen juice regelated into a popsicle overnight.
meanings.sent4: The pond regelated into a smooth sheet of ice, perfect for skating.
meanings.sent5: The cold temperature caused the water to regelate quickly, forming icicles on the roof.

meanings.definition: To cause to become solid again.
meanings.sent1: She used the freezer to regelate the melted chocolate back into a solid state.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to regelate the sauce after it had been left out too long.
meanings.sent3: The magic spell accidentally regelated the liquid potion into a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's experiment regelated the liquid metal into a strong alloy.
meanings.sent5: The cold air helped regelate the soft butter into a firm consistency.

meanings.definition: To undergo the process of freezing again.
meanings.sent1: The ice cubes began to regelate as the temperature dropped in the freezer.
meanings.sent2: If you reheat the soup and let it cool, it will regelate into a thick stew.
meanings.sent3: The slushy snow regelated into a slippery ice patch on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The river water regelated into a solid block of ice during the cold winter.
meanings.sent5: The melted chocolate regelated into a hard shell on the dessert.
